question: You plan to secure remote access from your on-premises network to your AKS cluster with minimum network latency and maximum security. Which solution will you choose?
explanation: Azure ExpressRoute does not use the public Internet, increasing security and control over network performance.

question: You are configuring an Azure Firewall instance. You want to ensure all traffic from an Azure subnet going to www.soraimx.com is routed through the Azure Firewall. Which option should you implement?
explanation:
You can configure application rules that define fully qualified domain names (FQDNs) that can be accessed from a subnet, and network rules that define source address, protocol, destination port and address.

question: You need to enforce that all new resources are created in specific Azure regions. You create an Azure policy. Does this meet your objective?
explanation:
You can assign a policy to enforce a condition for resources you create in the future. For the exam, know what initiatives and blueprints are as well.

Initiative = a group of policies

Blueprints for governed environments

question: Admins can configure permission scopes ahead of any user consent

answers.answer: By either providing a code or entering their password
Providing a code back to the app

explanation: In the OAuth code Grant flow, the user confirms consent by entering a code into a textbox provided

question: VMs included in an Application Security Group cannot be located in different Azure regions.
explanation: VMs included in an Application Security Group cannot be located in different Azure regions.

question: You create a new Azure Key Vault and want to ensure that permanent deletions of secrets, keys, and certificates can be recovered for at least 30 days. Which two settings will you enable?
explanation:
When soft-delete is enabled, resources marked as deleted resources are retained for a specified period (90 days by default). Purge protection ensures objects cannot be purged during the retention period.

Soft delete is ON by default, but purge protection is OPTIONAL

question: The following are the available types of Azure resource locks.
explanation: The two resource lock types are CanNotDelete and ReadOnly

question: What is the advantage of using an App Service certificate in managing TLS/SSL communication on your web app. (Choose all that apply)

answers.answer: Certificate is stored in Azure Key Vault
Certificate is issued by a trusted 3rd party provider
Certificate renewal is managed by Azure

explanation: Certificates acquired through this App Service feature are stored in Key Vault, are renewed automatically, and come from a trusted provider, such as Digicert.

question: You can limit operations on a key in Azure Key Vault by configuring the settings under Permitted operations
explanation: You can limit a variety of operations under Permitted operations, like Encrypt, Decrypt, Sign, and Verify.

question: You need to delegate access to an admin for a VM named “VM1” in the “ContosoVM” resource group. They should have full control over the VM but should not be able to grant access to other users. What permissions will you assign
explanation: Contributor role access grants all rights except the ability to grant rights to others. Scoping to the VM object only ensures permissions are not granted to other VMs in the resource group.

question: When Microsoft Defender for container registries is enabled, any image you push to your registry will be scanned immediately.
explanation: Both the Synchronized and Federated models leverage Azure AD Connect or Azure AD Connect Cloud Sync.

question: _____ and _____ are required for access for an application that has been registered with Azure AD for modern user authentication.
explanation: Think of client ID and client secret as the user and password. A redirect URI is the location that the authorization server will send the user to once the app has been successfully authorized and granted an authorization code or access token.

question: Which of the following options can be used to create custom RBAC roles? Select all that apply
explanation: All are valid options for creating custom RBAC roles except ARM template. You can configure an existing custom RBAC role with an ARM template.

question: What is the minimum Azure RBAC role required to view Azure Monitor logs?
explanation: The Monitoring Reader role has read-only access to monitoring data.

question: Azure AD Passthrough authentication (PTA) is associated with which of the following identity models?
explanation:
Because it passes the authentication request to on-premises active directory, passthrough Authentication (PTA) is associated with the Synchronized identity model

On premise password are never stored in the cloud supports control not present in azure AD ,like “logon hours”

question:
Azure VMs can communicate across VNETs by default 

justify your answer

answers.answer: By default, a NSG will block all access, and the allow rules will over write this. You can then create an Allow rule to overwrite this to allow specific VNET.
requires VNET peering or VPN connectivity.

explanation: VMs on subnets within the same VNET have connectivity. Communication across VNETs requires VNET peering or VPN connectivity

question: You can create new users in Azure AD with the create- AzureADUser cmdlet.
explanation: This is false, The New-AzureADUser cmdlet is used to create new users in Azure AD

question: With Azure SQL, you can configure Azure AD Domain Services authentication.
explanation: Azure SQL supports Azure AD authentication, but not Azure AD Domain Services authentication.

question: You need to implement security in SQL server to ensure database admins never see sensitive customer info, such as credit card data, in databases they manage. Which option should you choose?
explanation: Always Encrypted allows clients to encrypt sensitive data inside client applications and never reveal the encryption keys to the Database Engine. As a result, Always Encrypted provides separation between data owner and manager.

question: In Azure SQL Database Always Encrypted, two types of column encryption are supported. (Choose both types from the list below)
explanation:
All Azure SQL Database Always Encrypted supports deterministic and randomized encryption

Deterministic encryption supports equality lookups, joins, and group by operations but is slightly less secure than Randomized.

question: You need to provide a user access to download content from your Storage Account, limited to 24 hours. Which option should you choose?

answers.answer: Storage Blob Data Reader RBAC role

explanation: SAS tokens offer a variety of controls to limit time and scope of access, where shared keys offer the equivalent of root access forever.

question: The VM vulnerability scanning feature in Microsoft Defender can also scan for vulnerabilities in open-source databases on Azure VMs.
explanation: Only Microsoft SQL on VMs is available.

question: Azure AD Privileged Identity Management  (PIM) supports which of the following features when users request to activate a privileged identity profile?

answers.answer: a ticket number in a helpdesk system
an explanation of why they need to activate

explanation: Azure AD Privileged Identity Management supports all three of these options, alone or in any combination.

question: You are configuring security using a managed identity for your custom web app. Which option will minimize administrative effort?
explanation: A system managed identity is lower effort than a user managed identity because its password is maintained automatically. It is also deprovisioned automatically when the associated resource is deprovisioned.

question: Which Azure platform log captures data plane events?
explanation: Resource logs provide insight into operations that were performed within an Azure resource (the data plane)

question: SSH is disabled on AKS nodes by default.
explanation: AKS allows SSH from private IPs by default. On the topic of access, know that Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) can be configured to use Azure AD for user authentication.

question: What is the minimum required license to enable Azure AD Conditional Access for a user?
explanation: Azure AD Premium P1 is the minimum licensing required to enable Azure AD Conditional Access policies.

question: Transferring a subscription to a new Azure AD tenant will cause Azure VMs to stop running
explanation: This transfer will result in Azure role assignments being permanently deleted. It will impact managed identities. VMs will not stop running, but you will have to re-enable or recreate any managed identities after the transfer.

question: You need to obfuscate data in Azure SQL at the record level. Which feature will you use?
explanation:
Dynamic data masking (sometimes simply called “dynamic masking” enables partially obscuring sensitive data, like a credit card number or email address.

Examples ****-****-****-4656 or  akira.****@****.com

question: To provide full access to the resources in an Azure resource group, you should grant only the Contributor role for the subscription.
explanation: There is no need to grant permissions at the subscription level. Always apply rule of least privilege when configuring RBAC in Azure. The Contributor role provides all permissions except the ability to grant access to others

question: What are the types of authentication are supported as an access control measure to Azure SQL Database? (Choose two)
explanation: You can use traditional SQL authentication (user and password) or enable Azure AD authentication. Your apps can use a connection string, but this will generally leverage SQL authentication

question: You need to ensure that all your Azure VMs have a consistent operating system configuration at deploy time. Which of the following options would you configure?
explanation: DSC will enable policy-based configuration of the OS and is used by management features such as Azure Update Management.

question: When multiple Azure Active Directory Conditional Access policies apply to a user, which of the following are true?

answers.answer: Policies are not applied in a particular order
Policies with device settings take precedence
Policies are applied in order by created date
Block access takes priority over all settings

explanation: For every sign-in, Azure Active Directory evaluates all policies and ensures that all requirements in all applicable policies are met before granting access to the user. Block access takes priority over all other configuration settings

question: For app registration, what are the permission types supported by the Microsoft identity platform?
explanation: Delegated permissions are used by apps that have a signed-in user present. Application permissions are used by apps that run without a signed-in user present

question: You are configuring Azure Policy. Which of the following policy effects require you to assign a managed identity? (Choose two)
explanation: Because they are write actions, Modify and DeployIfNotExists require a managed identity to succeed

question: Network Security Groups include a rule to allow RDP access on which port by default?
explanation: No rule is configured to enable remote access by default

question: You need to block outbound Internet traffic from Azure VMs, while allowing global access to Azure Storage, with minimum administrative effort. Which technology will you use?
explanation: NSG Service Tags allow you to block outbound access to the Internet, but still allow access to Azure storage in the same region for diagnostics & metrics.

question: When creating alert rules in Azure Monitor for events in the Azure Activity log, what must you configure to notify users when an alert is triggered?
explanation: An action group is a collection of notification preferences defined by the owner of an Azure subscription. Azure Monitor and Service Health alerts use action groups to notify users that an alert has been triggered.

question: When you don't know how long you need to retain data in a blob, you can configure a legal hold.
explanation: A legal hold remains in place until you release it, preventing the blob from being deleted.

question: Which of the Azure RBAC roles below will allow you to create custom RBAC roles in Azure? (Choose all that apply)
explanation: You need explicit permissions to create custom roles, such as Owner or User Access Administrato

question: You notice that when you attempt to investigate an incident created from your custom rule in Microsoft Sentinel that the investigation graph is empty. What is the most likely cause?
explanation: You'll only be able to investigate the incident if you used the entity mapping fields when you set up your analytics rule. The investigation graph requires that your original incident includes entities.

question: Just-in Time VM Access and Azure Bastion are designed to work together.
explanation: The JIT VM Access feature provides a gated solution for RDP and SSH to public IPs. Azure Bastion provides remote access via a browser and Azure portal using a VMs private IP.

question: An Azure Bastion host provides _____ and _____ connectivity to workloads sitting behind the bastion host
explanation: While you connect to the bastion host on 443 from the Azure portal, the bastion provides RDP (Windows) and SSH (Linux) connectivity to Azure VMs.

question: Playbooks in Microsoft Sentinel use a special _____ to instantiate an automated response using an Azure Logic App.
explanation: Security playbooks are Azure Logic Apps that use a special trigger designed for Microsoft Sentinel.

question: Which of the following roles can manage assignments for other administrators in Privileged Identity Management (PIM) for Azure AD roles?
explanation: The Global Administrator who enables Privileged Identity Management (PIM) for an organization automatically get role assignments and access to PIM. The first user can assign others to the Privileged Role Administrator role.

question: Which Microsoft tool is designed to help identify and mitigate potential application security issues early in the software development lifecycle (SDLC)?
explanation: The Microsoft Threat Modeling Tool enables software architects to evaluate designs using the STRIDE threat modeling methodology.

question: Microsoft Defender for Cloud recommendations are listed in descending order of the severity of the security vulnerabilities they address
explanation: Recommendations are listed in descending order of the point value (impact) to the Security Score.

question: You can bind client certificates to which App Service Plan tiers?
explanation: App Service supports client certificates on Basic, Standard, Premium, or Isolated tiers.

question: Shared access signature (SAS) tokens can be configured to restrict access by IP address.
explanation: Yes, SAS tokens can restrict access to specific IPs or IP ranges, for specific resources, and if desired, for a limited period of time.

question: Which of the following statements is true for an Azure Policy initiative? An initiative is:
explanation: An Azure initiative is a collection of Azure policy definitions that are grouped together towards a specific goal or purpose in mind

question: In Privileged Identity Management, what are the available settings when an assigned reviewer does not complete the review before the configured review ends?
explanation: You have a variety of options with PIM reviews, enabling you to remove access from users who do not respond to reviews if necessary. Another option, “Take recommendations” is also available.

Manually using the Azure CLI before create container
Automatically during AKS deployment via the Azure CLI
Manually using the Azure CLI before AKS deployment

question: You need to continually evaluate the security posture of all identities in Azure Active Directory. You need to provide risk level, risk events, and current status. What should you configure?
explanation: Identity Protection is a tool that allows organizations to automate the detection and remediation of identity-based risks and investigate risks using data in the portal

question: Which of the following logs capture control plane operations in your Azure subscription?
explanation: Activity logs provide information about Azure Resource Manager control plan operations like CREATE, UPDATE, and DELETE operations.

question: When configuring Single Sign On (SSO) for hybrid users, you need to ensure that all user passwords are evaluated by the on-premises Active Directory domain controller. What action will you take?

answers.answer: Add users to a Privileged Identity Management profile
Add users to a Privileged Identity Management profile
Configure Group Writeback in Azure AD Connect

question: In Microsoft Sentinel, ________ are groups of related ________ that together create an actionable potential threat that you can investigate and resolve.
explanation: Incidents are groups of related alerts that together create an actionable, potential threats that you can investigate and resolve. Microsoft Sentinel uses analytics and machine learning rules to correlate low fidelity alerts into high fidelity incidents.

question: What are the options for configuring a custom RBAC role in Azure AD? (choose the best answer)
explanation: Custom RBAC roles can be configured both in the Azure portal and programmatically.

question: The Free tier of Microsoft Defender for Cloud allows you to change the default policy to disable checks that you wish to ignore.
explanation: Yes, you can change the default Microsoft Defender policy settings, even in the Free tier.

question: Azure APIs can be protected by configuration of permission scopes to limit access to a 3rd party web app, even when users consent
explanation: Admins can configure permission scopes ahead of any user consent

question: A resource forest in Azure AD Domain Services will sync accounts from on?premises as well as Azure
explanation: Only a user forest synchronizes accounts from on-premises Active Directory (AD).

question: soraimx.com hosts Azure resources which they have shared with guest users from Watashi corp. Both orgs have their own Azure AD tenant. Which tenant owns the user lifecycle in this external identity scenario?
explanation: The resource tenant is soraimx.com, which owns the lifecycle of guest account access. The account tenant is Watashi, which owns the credentials in the Watashi Azure AD tenant that was granted guest access.

question: The free tier of Microsoft Defender for Cloud can identify deficiencies in baseline Azure network configuration, such as a subnet without a network security group (NSG).
explanation:
The free tier of Microsoft Defender for Cloud does identify configurations that deviate from best practices for network resources, as well as storage, compute, and other services.

The free tier of Microsoft Defender for Cloud does identify configurations that deviate from best practices for network resources, as well as storage, compute, and other services.

question: You cannot configure Always Encrypted for individual database columns containing your sensitive data.
explanation: You can encrypt individual database columns. Always Encrypted is a data encryption technology that ensures that sensitive data never appears as plaintext inside the database system.

question: SAS tokens provide root access to an Azure Storage account until the key is revoked or rolled
explanation: This describes Shared Keys. SAS tokens are restricted to specified permissions for a limited period of time (specified at creation time)

question: You can configure Azure AD authentication for which of the following?
explanation: Only Azure Storages queues and blobs support Azure AD authentication.

question: Azure Firewall requires you to specify the number of network virtual appliances according to your expected scale needs.
explanation: Azure Firewall requires you to specify the number of network virtual appliances according to your expected scale needs. For the exam, ensure you are familiar with Azure Firewall Manager for central policy management of multiple firewalls

question: Azure Storage accounts are encrypted by default:
explanation: All Azure Storage accounts are always encrypted by default. Customers can choose to choose to manage their own keys for encrypting the storage service.

question: Which of the following are advantages of Azure Bastion over traditional remote desktop access?

answers.answer: Supports both Windows and Linux VMs
No public IP addresses are necessary
The session is managed in the browser

explanation: Azure Bastion provides remote access directly from the Azure portal over port 443, connecting to private IP addresses of the target Azure VMs

question: Which Microsoft Sentinel RBAC role is required to allow an analyst to manage incidents (assign, dismiss, etc.)? (choose the best answer)
explanation: Microsoft Sentinel Responder can manage incidents (assign, dismiss, etc.). So can the Microsoft Sentinel Contributor, but that role also includes authoring rights.

question: Which of the following roles are required to manage assignments for other administrators in PIM for Azure resource roles?
explanation: A user cannot manage Privileged Identity Management for resources without Resource Administrator permissions.

question: You need to secure all guest user identities by only allowing logging into Microsoft Teams via Windows endpoints, always enforcing MFA. What should you implement to accomplish this goal?
explanation: Conditional Access supports rule configuration based on platform, app, risk, location, and more.

question: Physical isolation in AKS provides the highest pod density for running workloads.
explanation: Separate physical nodes result in lower pod density and greater management overhead.

question: Microsoft best practices recommend adding an additional layer of access control security to Azure SQL databases. Which feature will you implement?
explanation: You can create server-level firewall rules for single and pooled databases.

question: Azure Container Registry (ACR) supports Kubernetes and Docker running on third?party cloud platforms.
explanation:
ACR is a Docker container registry and does not disallow access from clouds other than Azure, with proper authentication.

When Microsoft Defender for container registries is enabled, any image you push to your registry will be scanned immediately.

question: What is the format of an OpenID Connect token?
explanation: OpenID tokens are JSON Web Token (JWT) format. They are sent to the client application as part of an OpenID Connect (OIDC) flow and are used by the client to authenticate the user.

question: Azure Disk Encryption uses Bitlocker to encrypt OS and data volumes.
explanation:
Azure Disk Encryption does utilize Bitlocker, but only for Windows machines.

DM-CRYPT is used for Linux VMs

question: You are deploying VMs using ARM templates. You want to include enrollment into Azure Log Analytics as part of the deployment. Which two parameters must you include in the ARM template?
explanation: You will need to provide the Log Analytics WorkspaceID and WorkspaceKey for the VM extension that deploys the agent

question: Which modes are available for rules in Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF)? (choose two)

question: The Azure Virtual Network Container Network Interface (CNI) enables advanced networking for the following container solutions.
explanation: Azure Virtual Network CNI supports AKS, AKS Engine, as well as Docker Also works with Kubernetes resources such as services, ingress controllers, and Kube DNS.

question: When securing Azure Key Vault (AKV), you need to secure the 1) AKV instance and the 2) secrets hosted in the key vault. Which controls are used for each? (choose the best answer)
explanation: You control access to a Key Vault instance (management plane) with role-based access control (RBAC). You can secure secrets, certs, and passwords in the vault (data plane) with access policies or RBAC.

question: Microsoft Defender for Cloud includes a "quick fix" option to add a vulnerability assessment solution to your Azure virtual machines. Which partner option is integrated with Defender for this feature?
explanation: This VM scanning capability from Qualys was incorporated into the Standard tier of Microsoft Defender for Cloud with simplified deployment for free.

question: You want to ensure access for all Azure SQL instances from a specific VNET does not traverse the public Internet. Which solution will you implement?
explanation:
Service endpoint is configured at the VNET level for all instances of a PaaS service, optimizing traffic routing over the Azure backbone network. The destination IP is still a public IP (but accessed via the Azure backbone)

Know the differences between Private Link, Private Endpoint, and Service Endpoint

question: Azure Policy allows the assignment of a policy to a management group. What level of scope is affected by a policy targeted to a management group?

answers.answer: All resource groups in a subscription
All resource groups in a subscription
Resource groups in the management groups

explanation: A management group facilitates targeting policy to multiple subscriptions of your choosing, or all subscriptions in the tenant if you target the root group.

question: The following security principals may be granted rights to a resource group:
explanation: Options Service Principal, Managed Identity, and Azure AD User are all security principals to which resource group access may be granted

question: Defender for Cloud fills three vital needs as you manage the security of your resources and workloads in the cloud and on-premises in FREE TIER

Just in time VM Access,DDOS,Defender for Cloud secure score

question: To achieve high availability for VMs in an Azure region, the following options are available

answers.answer: Azure Site Recovery and Availability Zones
Availability Sets and Azure Site Recovery
Availability Sets, Availability Zones, Azure Site Recovery

explanation: Both Availability Sets and Availability Zones enable VM high availability (HA) in an Azure region. Azure Site Recovery delivers disaster recovery (DR), not HA.

question: Which of the following can be associated to a Network Security Group (NSG)? Select all that apply.
explanation: You can configure NSGs on subnet and Network Interface Card (NIC) and may be used together if desired

question: Azure Monitor can be used to alert on events of interest to Security Operations (SecOps).
explanation: Events from the Administrative and Security categories of the Activity Log are definitely of interest to SecOps

question: Which of the following solutions features automated security investigations?
explanation:
Only Microsoft Defender for Endpoint includes an automated investigation feature (as of Jan 2022).

Response automation is possible in Sentinel with playbooks, but is not full-scale automated investigation

question: You can configure the following scanning options for your container images for Azure Kubernetes Service
explanation: Scanning of both the ACR and AKS runtime are possible to identify vulnerabilities related to your containerized services.

question: Activity log events are retained in Azure for ?
explanation: Guest OS metrics sent to Azure Monitor Metrics: These performance counters are collected by the Windows diagnostic extension and sent to the Azure Monitor data sink, or the InfluxData Telegraf agent on Linux machines, or the newer Azure Monitor agent via data-collection rules. Retention for these metrics is 93 days, As mentioned earlier, for most resources in Azure, platform metrics are stored for 93 days

question: Microsoft Defender for SQL can scan your Azure SQL databases weekly to identify vulnerabilities.
explanation:
Microsoft Defender for SQL can scan your Azure SQL databases weekly to identify vulnerabilities.

You can also set custom baselines for permissions and feature configurations, and database settings

question: Playbooks in Microsoft Sentinel are based on which of the following technologies?
explanation: Security playbooks are based on Logic Apps and include specific triggers and actions to automate response to alerts in Microsoft Sentinel

question: How do you enable the Basic tier of Azure DDoS for your Azure subscriptions?

answers.answer: Enable Azure DDoS within Microsoft Defender

explanation: Azure DDoS Basic is enabled by default in the Azure platform, which constantly monitors traffic and enforces real-time mitigation of the most common network attacks. No configuration is required for the Basic tier.

question: The following resources support Azure resource firewall.
explanation: Azure SQL Servers and Databases, as well as Azure Storage Accounts support resource firewall. Several other Azure PaaS services also support resource firewall.

question: What is the minimum Azure Active Directory built-in RBAC role required to manage Azure Key Vault?
explanation: To grant access to a user to manage key vaults, you assign a predefined Key Vault Contributor role to the user at a specific scope.

question: the Masking field format drop-down list for masking sensitive data which is Default value
explanation: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-sql/database/dynamic-data-masking-configure-portal?view=azuresql

question: Microsoft recommends shared keys in Azure Storage should be rolled automatically using which core service?
explanation: Microsoft recommends automating rolling of storage account keys exclusively with Key Vault.

question: Just-in-Time VM access allows the requester to specify duration of access up to the configured maximum.
explanation: Just-in-Time VM access allows the requester to specify duration of access up to the configured maximum.

question: You can enforce data residency and sovereignty using which of the following?
explanation: Azure Policy enables you to configure an "allowed locations" policy to limit deployments to your approved Azure regions only.
